column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: SpdDrv, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a complete hysterectomy in Aug 2010 I have been taking this medication for about 2 months, the first month my Dr had given me samples which were 25mg a pill worked very good sex was easier and NO hot flashes (which I have horrible hot flashes at night) I got my first script filled and it is only 10mg a pill (didn't think about looking at that until I read reviews here that I found the difference) now my hot flashes are HORRIBLE again every morning between 4 and 5 AM I am wringing wet with sweat! the dryness is ok enough I don't feel like I dry as a bone down there but not enough for sex..  I haven't had any of the side effects that has been mentioned although I do worry about cancer because breast cancer runs in my family both my Mom and my grandmother (moms mom) both have had breast cancer.  My Dr didn't mention any side effects to me.  Although I find it kind of odd that I used to have headaches regularly and seems they have decreased some since I started meds

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: While the results have been beneficial the cost is high. I have had headaches where before I rarely had them. I have had hair loss which was stopped once I reduced dosage to once a week and have also had acne which I have never had in my life. Also have experienced bouts of loose bowels daily during first two weeks of starting vagifem and now once or twice a week after taking dosage.  Blood tests showed my levels went from low 30's to high 40's after first 3 months and now I am waiting results of 6 month test at reduced dosage(1x week) so it does enter bloodstream.

column1: Wasting of Tissues of the Vulva
column2: Jan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My GP prescribed this treatment as I have been experiencing dryness pain and discomfort in the vaginal area due to early menopause (I am 45).  I used the drug for the first 14 days, found it to be initially very painful inserting the applicator due to dryness.  It did resolve the vaginal dryness issue.  However, I immediately experienced headaches, blurred vision / dizziness (I rarely suffer from headaches).  Extreme mood swings, anxiety, bloating / swelling and tenderness around the abdominal area, water retention around the face and eyes.  Hot flushes worsened when prior to taking the drug they were a minor inconvenience and this affected my sleep pattern, felt very tired, difficulties focussing on tasks.  Spoke to my GP again on the 15th day and was advised that it was highly unlikely that the drug had caused all these symptoms and that it was the menopause.  I asked why I would have these symptoms within 14 days the GP said that I may be over sensitive to the drug. I decided to stop taking the drug, a week later and I am feeling much better.  I am using Isoflavones 40mg now which is derived from Red Clover and using vaseline for the dryness.

column1: Other

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: Valerie M., 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm post menopausal and have experienced hot flashes, mood swings, night sweats, lack of libido for the last few years. During this time, I was experiencing a dryness and uncomfortable feeling during sexual intercourse. Using a lubricant helped, but I had to use a lot and it was messy. I took vagifem twice a week for two weeks and have noticed more moisture in my vaginal area. Sexual intercourse is much more comfortable. I have noticed that my mood swings and evened out. I still get mild daily hot flashes, but I'm sleeping better and do not have night sweats anymore.

column1: Other
column2: works, but at what cost?, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication is effective. BUT, and there is always a 'BUT', it gave me unwanted side effects. Headache and dizziness. May help 'down there' but makes it worse 'up there' (my head). Not worth it. I had very few headaches, until I started taking this drug. When I stop the med, headaches go away.  So... if this medication 'suppposedly' does not get into the blood, how can it effect me in such a profound way ?  Don't believe it doesn't get into your blood. I won't be taking this anymore. You have got to ask yourself the same question. Drug company benefits, patient loses. It is always that way, like when you go to Vegas. The odds are just like that, favorite the 'house'

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation

I had my reservations about taking it, since my mother had breast cancer when she was just slightly older than I am.  These reviews reinforce my initial gut feeling.  No, no and no.

column1: Other
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: BEWARE OF INSTANT SAVING CARD OFFER. It states "pay no more than $10.00 on each of your next 4 presciptions of Vagifem 10mcg" Using this card printed from website ended up paying $53.07 NOT $10.00. The pharmasist called, was told that there was a max NOVO NORDISK would pay. I called spoke w/ customer service manager, told she understood my accusing them of false advertizing and will pass along to proper person. She offered a small compensation to me ( one free refill) I have not accepted this offer . When I decided to try Vagifem, it was a $40.00 max cost 4 months @ $10.00), now it will be $212.28. THAT my friends is false advertising, and very bad business practice. It makes me question the trustworthyness of Novo Nordisk. I hope I have made an awareness that is helpful. By the way I'm on day 6 w/ this product so too early to tell, I'm taking it for vaginal atrophy. Because I believe in positive thinking, I'm afraid that the distaste for the company may hinder the effectiveness. Hope this was helpful.

First one okay, 2nd one burns (still is 3 days later).  The only thing that has kept me from going insane is an OTC long-lasting moisturizer.  I'm not sure if I can put the name here so I won't.  It's not perfect.  It's messy and if you're really dry it can burn for a few days but should get better.  The Vagifem just keeps burning.  Vagifem also caused me to bloat. column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: kateannac, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Bottom line, everyone reacts differently to Vagifem.  I happen to have a very sensitive system and found that Vagifem didn't work for me at all. The reality is, while you may be inserting Vagifem internally within the vagina, The medication does go into your blood stream..  The vagina is highly vascular - how could it NOT effect the rest of your body!  I have to admit, Vagifem did seem to work initally, but after a few months of use.. the symptoms of my condition really didn't change that drastically and the reactions to the Vagifem were more bothersome than my initial diagnosis of Vaginal Atrophy!  Since using Vagifem, I have developed swelling in my hands, as well as tingling sensations in my feet and in my legs, behind my knees.   I have also noticed occasional pain in my left arm.I am NOT a hypcodriac, nor am I an alarmist or a person that just overreacts to things... These symtoms are VERY real and it appears a high number of you are also experiencing adverse reactions to Vagifem.  I am going to recommend that people look to NATURAL products to heal the burning, pressure, pain, etc.. associated from Vaginal Atrophy.  There are other ways to incorporate and rebuild estrogen in your system - i.e., Remifemin and Estroven. Try to include more SOY and flaxseed in your daiy diet.  Do some research ladies..   Good luck and please, pay attention to your body!  Stop the Vagifem and visit a GNC or local healthfood store for NATURAL alternatives to increase your estrogen.Good luck!
